alert.note: Alert for Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 2:42PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Aroostook County through 330 PM EDT... At 240 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Haynesville, or 12 miles northwest of Danforth, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haynesville, Reed Plantation, Weston, Orient, Bancroft and Glenwood. This includes US Highway 1 near Orient. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
